html.p: To use Zero Install, you will need:

ul.li: GTK (2.12 or later needed for both CLI/GUI).
PyGTK (2.12 or later needed for both CLI/GUI).

html.p: There is currently no package available.

You can either install Zero Install for regular Mac OS X (Quartz),
or for the Darwin sub-system with X11 using MacPorts or Fink.
You need to do four installations and two compilations, for requirements:

ul.li: python-2.5.4-macosx.dmg (Universal Binary, for Mac OS X 10.3.9 and later)

li.p: Compile GTK from source, using jhbuild

You will need the Xcode Tools for this, installed separately.
Comes bundled with the OS, but needs to be updated at ADC.

You cannot mix the GTK-OSX installation with MacPorts/Fink,
so make sure that they are not in the PATH/FLAGS variables...

li.pre:
$ sh gtk-osx-build-setup.sh $ jhbuild bootstrap
$ jhbuild build meta-gtk-osx-bootstrap $ jhbuild build meta-gtk-osx-core

li.p: Compile PyGTK from source, using jhbuild

html.p: Once the requirements have been added, it's time for Zero Install itself:

li.p: Install Zero Install from source, with distutils

Download, verify, and extract the archive as per source installation.
Note that Mac OS X uses curl to download files, instead of wget.

html.p: Now the installation is complete. To start Zero Install, you use commands:

dd.p: You can install the sysutils/zeroinstall-injector package in MacPorts using this command, which will also install requirements like lang/python25, mail/gnupg, x11/gtk2 and python/py25-gtk:
There is no package for zeroinstall-injector in Fink, but you can use it to install the requirements and then install Zero Install from source in the Fink environment until a package is provided:
dd.pre: $ sudo fink install python25 gnupg gtk+2 pygtk2-py25

html.p: You now have two new commands: 0launch, which takes the URL of a program and runs it, and 0alias, which lets you use short names instead of URLs.
